Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 531390: Other Activities Related to Real Estate
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Ryland Group Inc., one of the nation's largest homebuilders, will pay a civil penalty of $625,000 to resolve alleged Clean Water Act violations at its construction sites, including sites located in the Chesapeake Bay Watershed, the Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced. Ryland will also invest in compliance programs to improve employee training and increase management oversight at all current and future construction sites. The company is required to inspect its current and future construction sites routinely to minimize stormwater runoff from sites.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/homebuilder-ryland-group-inc-pay-625000-clean-water-act-penalty-and-implement-company-wide

Private Litigation Case Title: Gundersen v. Lennar Associates Management, LLC et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/252388/lennar-settles-construction-workers-ot-class-fight
Notes: The terms of the settlement were redacted in the preliminary motion for approval but stated in the final version.

Description: Universal American Mortgage Company LLC agreed to pay the United States $13.2 million to resolve allegations that it violated the False Claims Act by falsely certifying that it complied with Federal Housing Administration (FHA) mortgage insurance requirements in connection with certain loans.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/universal-american-mortgage-company-llc-uamc-agrees-pay-132-million-resolve-false-claims-act

Description: The Ryland Group Inc., one of the nation's largest homebuilders, agreed to pay $625,000 to seven states and the federal government to resolve alleged Clean Water Act violations at its construction sites. The settlement was also announced by the Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-ryland-group-inc
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/homebuilder-ryland-group-inc-pay-625000-clean-water-act-penalty-and-implement-company-wide
